channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Oracle shares slide on earnings and revenue miss, disappointing forecast
item.description: Oracle shares fell in extended trading after the database software company issued disappointing quarterly results.

item.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO killing: Luigi Mangione gun charge hearing set for Monday
item.description: Luigi Mangione was arrested on a gun charge after police found him with a pistol consistent with the one used to kill UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.

item.title: From Trump and Turkey, to Russia and Iran â€” Syria's regime change has huge global consequences
item.description: The dramatic collapse of Bashar al-Assad's Syrian regime at the hands of rebel forces this weekend will have deep ramifications across the globe.

item.title: U.S. can become a crypto superpower with 'sensible' regulation, Eric Trump says
item.description: Speaking to CNBC's Dan Murphy in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates, Eric Trump said Monday that he'd been a "big fan of crypto for a long time."

item.title: OpenAI releases Sora, its buzzy AI video-generation tool
item.description: OpenAI released its buzzy AI video-generation tool, Sora.

item.title: Nvidia shares fall after China opens investigation over possible violation of antimonopoly law
item.description: Nvidia shares were under pressure after a Chinese regulator said it was investigating the chipmaker over possible violations of the country's antimonopoly law.

item.title: Ex-Dodge, Ram boss Tim Kuniskis returning to Stellantis after CEO's exit
item.description: Well-known Stellantis executive Tim Kuniskis is returning to the automaker effective immediately, CNBC has learned.

item.title: From failed accountant to Marvel and Barbie star: Simu Liu shares how he got out of 'rock bottom'
item.description: Actor Simu Liu was fired from Deloitte before becoming an actor. He's now investing in Asian American businesses and is outspoken about tackling discrimination.

item.title: He bought a KFC store in Australia for $100,000 in 1969. Today, his fast food company is worth over $3 billion
item.description: Jack Cowin, founder and chairman of Competitive Foods Australia, shares his "biggest break" in life, which ultimately made him a billionaire.

item.title: India appoints Revenue Secretary Sanjay Malhotra as new central bank governor
item.description: India has appointed Sanjay Malhotra as governor of the country's central bank for a three-year period, according to CNBC TV18.

item.title: Ant Group gets new CEO as billionaire founder Jack Ma talks up AI in rare appearance
item.description: Alibaba and Ant Group co-founder Jack Ma said the AI era over the next 20 years would "exceed everyone's imagination."

item.title: China vows 'more proactive' fiscal stimulus measures, 'moderately' looser monetary policy
item.description: China's leaders pledged "more proactive" fiscal and monetary policies next year to boost domestic consumption, according to an official readout.

item.title: UK business confidence falls to lowest level in almost two years after Labour budget
item.description: British businesses lost steam and pulled back on hiring last month, as industry reacted to the Labour government's bumper tax-raising budget, new data showed Monday.

item.title: China consumer inflation rate drops to a five-month low, missing expectations as economy slows
item.description: China's consumer prices rose less-than-expected in November, climbing 0.2% from a year ago, according to data from the National Bureau of Statistics released Monday.

item.title: Qatar energy minister: I don't 'worry much' about Trump's vow to lift LNG exports cap
item.description: "Additional LNG and additional competition is welcome," told CNBC's Dan Murphy at the Doha Forum.

item.title: President-elect Trump says Ukraine to 'possibly' receive less military aid
item.description: President-elect Trump tells NBC News Ukraine will likely receive less U.S. aid once he takes office.

item.title: McDonald's fired Pharrell Williams 3 timesâ€”and then he created its famous jingle 'I'm loving it'
item.description: Music producer Pharrell Williams didn't last long as a McDonald's employee, he said â€” he suffered primarily from what an expert calls "burnout by boredom."

item.title: Assad dynasty collapses in Syria as rebel forces claim Damascus
item.description: The defense forces of the Russia and Iran-backed Assad government have been struggling to stave off the lightning advance of rebel forces.

item.title: Trump is stacking his White House roster with uber-rich backers
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump is filling his next administration with billionaires and other mega-wealthy figures.

item.title: Appeals court upholds law ordering China-based ByteDance to sell TikTok or face U.S. ban
item.description: Members of Congress had raised national security concerns about TikTok due to its ownership by ByteDance, which is based in China.

item.title: Biden says U.S. will support Syria and its neighbors after Assad dynasty collapses
item.description: The U.S. plans to support Syria and its neighbors after rebels toppled Assad's dictatorship.

item.title: Nicole Kidman says this is the No. 1 reason she works so hard: 'I can create jobs for people'
item.description: The 57-year-old hasn't gone a year without appearing in a project since 2000.

item.title: Google CEO: AI development is finally slowing downâ€”'the low-hanging fruit is goneâ€™
item.description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai says AI development may feel slower in 2025 â€” and tech companies will "need deeper breakthroughs" than today's chatbots to get ahead.

item.title: South Korea's President Yoon survives impeachment motion after ruling party boycotts vote
item.description: The motion, tabled by opposition politicians, needed the support of two-thirds of South Korea's 300-member National Assembly to pass.

item.title: The weight-loss drug boom has become one of the internet's biggest scams
item.description: As demand for obesity drugs like Wegovy, Zepbound, Mounjaro and Ozempic, outpaces supply, online scams are rising, according to cybersecurity experts.

item.title: I bought one of Sicily's famous $1 homes and spent $446K renovating itâ€”take a look inside
item.description: Meredith Tabbone bought an abandoned house in Sicily for one euro and spent the next four years turning it into her dream home.

item.title: Payrolls increased 227,000 in November, more than expected; unemployment rate at 4.2%
item.description: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to rise 214,000 in November, according to the Dow Jones consensus forecast.

item.title: AI's growth is just getting started, BlackRock's thematic ETF head says
item.description: BlackRock's Jay Jacobs expects infrastructure and cybersecurity plays to shine in 2025. He cites the artificial intelligence boom as a major catalyst.

item.title: 'This was preventableâ€™: Corporate world shudders at new risks after slaying of UnitedHealthcare CEO
item.description: Threats against corporations have been rising for years, fueled in part by the echo chamber of social media and an increasingly polarized political environment.

item.title: A 'hidden' travel hack saves money on flights â€” if travelers can pull it off
item.description: Skiplagging can save money, but flyers can have their flights and miles canceled. They won't be banned from flying for life though, says Skiplagged's CEO.
